page.title: 10THE LOCO WORKS AND RED MOSS
page.content: On the extreme north-east of the area, is the{British Rail Engineering {and Locomotive Works(Horwich {Division),}but this has declined extensively in recent years, from nearly 2000 employees in the 1950's to only about 150, who are still employed in the foundry. The block to the north will cover this in more detail. In the northern part, is a large peat moss called{Red Moss}which has been steadily worked over the past thirty years. One edge of this has been used recently by Greater Manchester Council and other local authorities as a{tip. In the extreme south-east is{ {Fourgates Engineering}making sun-beds and plastic sheeting. They employ about twelve people. The building used to be the{school}before new premises were built across the road.
